text: With increasing demand for organ transplantation and patients deteriorating or dying on the waiting list, organs are now being increasingly used from donors previously considered too marginal. This requires improvements to donor management during the retrieval process, and of the organ during transport and subsequent implantation, in order to maintain outcomes.
title: Surgical issues in retrieval and implantation.
journal: British journal of hospital medicine (London, England : 2005)
